lead_paragraph: The Army said it would look for other routes for the pipeline, a victory for the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe in a battle that has become a global flash point.

byline.contributor: Jack Healy reported from Cannon Ball, and Nicholas Fandos from Washington. Maggie Haberman and John Schwartz contributed reporting from New York, and Coral Davenport from Washington.
byline.original: By JACK HEALY and NICHOLAS FANDOS

headline.print_headline: Protesters Gain Victory in Fight Over Oil Pipeline
headline.main: Protesters Gain Victory in Fight Over Dakota Access Oil Pipeline

snippet: The Army said it would look for other routes for the pipeline, a victory for the Standing Rock Sioux Tribe in a battle that has become a global flash point....
abstract: Standing Rock Sioux Tribe wins major victory in battle to block Energy Transfer Partners oil pipeline project near tribal lands in South Dakota when Army Corps of Engineers announces it will block construction and look for new route; remains unclear whether decision will hold when Donald Trump, who supports completion of pipeline, takes office.
